Function: Telomerase RNA component,involved in telomere maintenance as template in telomeric DNA synthesis,transcription up-regulated by endogeneous TERT.

Function: TRF1 is an essential component of shelterin, with important roles in telomere protection and telomere replication.

Function: TRF2 is essential for telomere capping owing to its roles in suppressing an ATM-dependent DNA damage response (DDR) at chromosome ends and inhibiting end-to-end chromosome fusions.
Literature_Name: TRF2 recruits the Werner syndrome (WRN) exonuclease for processing of telomeric DNA

Function: Telomerase is a ribonucleoprotein enzyme essential for the replication of chromosome termini in most eukaryotes.
Literature_Name: GWAS of Epigenetic Aging Rates in Blood Reveals a Critical Role for TERT

Description: X-ray repair complementing defective repair in Chinese hamster cells 5 (double-strand-break rejoining)
Function: The DNA repair protein Ku (a heterodimer of Ku70 and Ku80 subunits) associates with mammalian telomeres and contributes to telomere maintenance.
Literature_Name: Human Ku70/80 Associates Physically With Telomerase Through Interaction With hTERT

Function: MED1 is involved in embryonic development and important for?SP1?activity.

Function: It is?involved in stress response signalling and maybe in cell cycle control.
Literature_Name: Influence of Aging and Calorie Restriction on MAPKs Activity in Rat Kidney
